_comment: Created by EFisher on 24/01/2014 16:53:00 using v2.0
title: What proportion of people exceed the four hour target?
analysis_commentary: Overall, the proportion of people experiencing long waits for beds (over four hours), once a decision to admit has been made, rose between November 2010 and July 2013. In the first half (January to June) of 2013, 105,466 patients waited over four hours for a bed following a decision to admit. The period between January and April 2013 saw particularly high levels of patients waiting over four hours - 5.07% of all emergency admissions during this period, compared with an overall average of 2.22% for the preceding 26 months. The proportion waiting over four hours then dropped sharply after April 2013 (from May to mid-July 2013), with an average of 2.05% of emergency admissions waiting over four hours for a bed.
data_source: NHS England, A&E Waiting Times and Activity
